results.title: The amateurist
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A short, captivating video about surveillance, identity, watching and being watched. ‘The Amateurist’ slides along the edges of horror and satire to create an unsettling portrait of a woman on the brink of a technologically-driven madness.

results.title: The Apartment
results.brief_description: This classic romantic comedy gave Jack Lemmon one of his best roles. Lemmon was ideally cast as an ambitious clerk in a big insurance company trying to gain promotion by renting out his apartment to senior executives for their extra-marital trysts. Everything goes according to plan until Lemmon falls in love with elevator operator Shirley Maclaine - and discovers that she is the mistress of his boss Fred MacMurray. The three central performances were perfect and Lemmon and Maclaine both received well deserved Oscar nominations. This multi-award winning movie is one to be seen again and again.

constellations_primary.name: Apartment / Binary images
constellations_primary.description: [NEED TO CHANGE KEY WORK TO VERNON ENTYR FOR APARTMENT] The interiors in Apartment (2021) are rendered in just two colours: white and blue. Like black and white film, this monochromatic art style was first employed due to technological constraints. Many contemporary filmmakers and videogame developers have revisited older techniques like these for artistic effect.

results.title: Drugs in our time
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The first film in the series looks at the socioeconomic setting of drug abuse. Seeks reasons for rising use of drugs among young people, and concludes that children are making choices and it is up to adults to prepare them for this.

results.title: The Anzac Story
results.creator_credit: George I. Malcolm, Frank Hunter and ABC
results.brief_description: This video contains two programs pertaining to the history of the Anzacs using archival footage, drawings and stills and narrated by Barry Lineham. “Prelude to glory” - Presents a brief historical overview of Captain Cook’s landings in New Zealand and Australia and the following events which took place including colonisation, the chain of British governors, a Treaty with the Maoris, Federation in Australia, and the eventual lead up to World War I. With the advent of the War came the formation of the Anzac Corps, an alliance between the Australian and New Zealand defence forces, and a commitment by the Anzacs to fight for the British Empire in a war half a world away. Shows the sailing of the first convoy, the naval battle and sinking of the German battle ship “Emden” and the arrival of the Anzacs in Egypt. “Gallipoli” - Tells the story of this ill-fated war against the Turks, the tragic mistakes, the chaos and disorganisation, and the horrendous loss of young Anzacs (10,000 soldiers) from the botched up landing on 25 April 1915 in a small bay south of Ari Burnu (renamed Anzac Cove) to the eventual evacuation of all troops in December 1915.

results.title: Drugs and the very young
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The fourth film in the series suggests reasons why teenagers may begin to experiment with drugs. Using simulated everyday situations shows how children learn from example that drugs can bring pleasure and relief. Finally an expert outlines a program which presents real alternatives.

results.title: The Allure of drugs
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
This film examines the conflicting attitudes to drugs throughout history. Considers the introduction of coffee and tobacco, prohibition of alcohol and use of drugs in ancient cultures. Points out that periods of change often accompany the introduction of new drugs.

results.title: What some communities are doing
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The sixth film in the series describes two broadly based educational efforts to deal with the problem of youthful drug abuse: (1) designed by a school district; and (2) a community effort by some affluent suburbs. Emphasises the need for a total community commitment and planning.

results.title: The mystery of the pictures: plus four other stories
results.creator_credit: Ellen Meske, Jackie Cockle and Cosgrove Hall Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Animal shelf”.
Five stories are contained on this tape comprising THE MYSTERY OF THE PICTURES, TIMOTHY’S GUEST, LITTLE MUT FINDS AN EGG, KINKER’S CAMPING HOLIDAY and TIMOTHY’S HOMEWORK. THE MYSTERY OF THE PICTURES: The animals take some pictures with Timothy’s Polaroid camera and are surprised when dark shapes appear in them. While trying to solve the mystery the animals discover an unexpected visitor living opposite their shelf. TIMOTHY’S GUEST: The animals have a new friend to play with when Timothy offers to look after his cousin’s dog for the weekend. LITTLE MUT FINDS AN EGG: While Timothy is off playing golf the animals search for birds’ nests in Bluebell Wood. Little Mut finds what he is looking for as well as an unexpected visitor. KINKER’S CAMPING HOLIDAY: It seems like Kinker’s holiday is about to turn into one big disaster, but with a little help from the animals and their invention of a home made telephone system, things may turn out alright. TIMOTHY’S HOMEWORK: The animals help Timothy with his homework and do such a good job that Timothy wins a prize.

results.title: What can we do?
results.creator_credit: Joanne M Mock and KQED-TV (Television station : San Francisco, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Drugs: the children are choosing”.
The final films in the series looks at three different approaches to communication between adults and young people as they attempt to make decisions about life and drug. Includes scenes with pre-teens, teenagers, and college students. Urges all avenues of communication to be opened. From the series: Drugs: the children are choosing.
